author: busssard
title: A portal to audit and release funds
description: There is no platform to audit projects in an easy way while seeing what stage of the proposal they are in. Lets make it simple and fair!

f6_assessments.q0: I really liked this idea and I think it totally fits the objectives of the challenge. The idea is to create a portal where the community can follow the progress of projects; in this portal, there would also be "work packages", which are basically pieces of the project to be done, once the team presented results of the respective parts, the funding would be, little by little, released, and so the packages would advance and the money would be available. What I found great here was that it organized things in a very systematic, pre-standardized way. I believe that each project has its specificities, but it is certainly possible to predict a timeline of actions for each one of them and divide them into packages. I believe that the navigation needed here is a crucial point for the success of the idea. Because there would be many projects categorized, divided and specified. The UI/UX design needs to be studied in order to create the simplest possible platform. One question I had was precisely where this portal would be. A webpage, an app? It would be interesting for the author to clarify where he would be hosted. Other than that, I loved the idea itself, I think it would make monitoring projects much more accessible (it is very complicated to follow hundreds of funded projects, mirrored by the most diverse corners of the internet!).
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the author's ability to successfully execute the project, I would like more details about who he is. He gives us very little information about himself, all we know is that he is an engineer, an entrepreneur and has experience with financing distribution. But it would be important to have a more detailed curriculum, examples of previous work, how is this experience with the distribution of funding, what would the traditional method be like? It would be very beneficial if it attached a linkedin profile or some other platform where we could get to know it more closely. It would be very important for this project to have a UI/UX designer experience in order to build an intuitive and easy platform for any community member wishing to exercise auditability. It is also not clear whether the author himself would be the programmer, he does not say whether he intends to hire a marketing team to publicize the idea, etc. About the script, this part is very well detailed, and it is added with the division of expenses. While the author points out what would be done, he says how much funding would be used for a given part. And the steps are pretty well unraveled, so we have a solid sense of what's going to happen in each part. Therefore, what I think needs improvement is the presentation of the author itself and the explanation of the formation of a future team, mainly because it is not possible for a project of such complexity to be done by a single person. And as we were introduced to a team and what would be done by each professional, we would also have greater grounding in determining whether the money asked for in funding is justifiable.
f6_assessments.q2: The author is concerned with drawing definitions of success according to the passage of time, in a direct way to exercise auditability; I also think this could be done in two steps. First, of course, let us follow the construction of the platform itself. This could be done through meetings, in which the author shows the advances, which parts were made in certain periods of time. It is possible to know what to charge through the division of phases that he establishes, and because it is very detailed, we know exactly what to expect from each. And after completing this process of creating, it would be necessary to observe whether the platform was working properly, whether the auditability of the "hosted" projects really improved, whether the community is having access, what the community is thinking about browsing the portal, possible errors to be corrected. In other words, it is possible to monitor the progress of the project through the information provided during the proposal description, in addition to the aforementioned success metrics. It is enough that, first, the author establishes this bridge between the process and the community, and then the community itself uses the portal and gives feedback on the experience.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has identified a key deficiency in Project Catalyst's program: the lack of information on accepted Catalyst projects and their progress. 

Currently, a Google search for 'Cardano Project Catalyst Winning Proposals' returns only one relevant result (https://iohk.io/en/blog/posts/2021/01/12/project-catalyst-the-first-winning-proposals/). A Google search for 'Cardano Catalyst Project' returns 0 relevant results.

I think a portal for all relevant information would be helpful for would-be investors and the community to evaluate these projects. In my opinion, it's not clearly articulated in the proposal the value a portal like this would have. Proposer could include an imagined scenario into the proposal, from the perspective of a community member or IOHK, on how this platform can be used to evaluate whether a project should receive continued funding. 

The proposal is missing details on how this project can be scaled for the future. If successful, more and more projects will be listed on the website. Each of them will require updates on current data(financials, performance, achievements, etc). This data will have to be verified. Unlocking payments will also require manpower(if smart contracts are unused). I assume all of this would require funding. I think details on how this project can be sustainable in the long-term would make this proposal stronger.
f6_assessments.q1:
In my opinion, the proposal would benefit from a clear outline on how the infrastructure would be built:
- how many team members are needed? what skills do they need to have?
- Clarity on the execution of the roadmap. How will the interviews during the first month be conducted? What kind of performance metrics is the proposer looking to track? What goes into the process of defining work package as completed?
- include resources needed to implement the protocol. How will information on the current state of the project be gathered? Weekly interviews, email reports, etc; and how will this information be verified as true?
 - More specific, technical details regarding plans on smart contract, oracle pools, and selected auditing group.
- A better breakdown on how funding will be used. How much will go to recruiting team members? How much will go to building infrastructure?

I also think evidence on the proposer's experience of how "funding is unlocked in traditional settings" should be included.

With what's being shared, I am not confident that this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has provided with a timeline of 8 months. I find that it is lacking in information on the technical aspects of how the infrastructure would be built. Lacking this knowledge myself, I cannot evaluate even if it is shared. However, proposer will be able to convey expertise and instill confidence in voters if this information is shared in a clear and concise manner. 

Proposer has outlined success metrics to quantify success of the project. I find it to be lacking however. What tests need to be done to ensure the portal's implementation with ideascale? what will the team of developers be working on? If this proposal is used as a test of the described process, what would the proposer share during these 8 months?

I think the inclusion of these details would make for a stronger proposal
